quizzes.title: History Quiz: Color and Shade
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, stars, divine. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: A shade of what color is the color called jazzberry jam?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Red-violet

questions.question: Who killed the Nemean Lion, one of the most vicious monsters in Greek mythology?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Heracles

questions.question: Which of these colors has the following connotations: warning, fall, warmth, hope, summer, electricity?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yellow

questions.question: What historical drama, set during Christmas 1183, stars Peter OToole as King Henry II and Katharine Hepburn as Queen Eleanor?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Lion in Winter

questions.question: The color called pistachio is a shade of this general color.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Green

questions.question: Name Simbas daughter who is a central character in the Disney film The Lion King II: Simbas Pride.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kiara

questions.question: This term, denoting an internal organ, also refers to a color which is a mixture of dark brown and grey?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Liver

questions.question: The color byzantium is a shade of this color.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Purple

questions.question: The color coquelicot is a shade of this basic color.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Red

questions.question: Which of these terms is used to describe one of the scenarios concerning the end of the world?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Grey goo

questions.question: This comedienne, writer and actress, nicknamed Big S, is famous for performing her act as a caricature of a Jewish-American princess.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sarah Silverman

questions.question: What actress, nicknamed The Divine Sarah, supposedly slept in a coffin, claiming it helped her understand her tragic roles?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sarah Bernhardt

questions.question: A variation of what color is the shade called Harlequin?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Green

questions.question: What type of color is the color named thistle?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Purple

questions.question: This color is the national color of the Netherlands. In Canada and the United States it is associated with the field of engineering.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Orange

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Actress and Movie
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, nickname, raines. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What plant symbolized the love between Andie and Benjamin in the 2003 romantic comedy How to Lose a Guy in 10 Days?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fern

questions.question: What actress portrayed the unforgettable Cruella de Vil in the 1996 Walt Disney movie 101 Dalmatians?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Glenn Close

questions.question: What actress and comedienne won an Emmy Award for her satirical portrayal of Sarah Palin in a guest appearance on SNL?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tina Fey

questions.question: Sarah Brightman, who became the first artist to hold #1 spots on the Billboard Classical and Dance charts simultaneously, has what type of singing voice?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Soprano

questions.question: What was written with fingerprints on the wall behind the upside-down abstract painting in the 1995 thriller movie Seven?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Help me

questions.question: What is the function the Fifth Element according to the 1997 science fantasy movie The Fifth Element?

options.text: It unites the other four elements into organic life.
It destroys the universe when activated.
It creates a bridge between space and time.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It unites the other four elements into organic life.

questions.question: In the 1999 movie The 13th Warrior, Wendol appears as this animal to frighten his enemies.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bear

questions.question: Whose wife was Sarah according to the Hebrew Bible and the Quran?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Abrahams

questions.question: One of the US First Ladies was named Sarah Childress. Who was she married to?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James K. Polk

questions.question: What is the nickname of Nicolas Cages character Randal Raines in the 2000 action movie Gone in 60 Seconds?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Memphis

questions.question: What popular nursery rhyme was written by author and editor Sarah Josepha Hale, who campaigned for making Thanksgiving a national holiday in the US?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mary Had a Little Lamb

questions.question: What title did Sarah Ferguson assume upon marrying Queen Elizabeth IIs second son, Prince Andrew?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Duchess of York

questions.question: What actress, named Sarah, is not correctly matched with the TV show in which she appeared?

options.text: Sarah Paulson - All My Children (Kendall Hart)
Sarah Michelle Gellar - Buffy the Vampire Slayer (Buffy)
Sarah Joy Brown - General Hospital (Carly Corinthos)

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sarah Paulson - All My Children (Kendall Hart)

questions.question: What actor depicted King Xerxes in the 2007 American action movie 300?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rodrigo Santoro

questions.question: Sarah Jessica Parkers popular character Carrie Bradshaw writes a weekly column called Sex and the City for this newspaper.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The New York Star

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Movie and Country
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, coin, derives. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What nickname did the priest and the cemetery gardener give to Ned, the dog in the 2007 suspense movie The Number 23?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Guardian of the Dead

questions.question: What kind of movie is the 1988 British film The Fruit Machine, also known as Wonderland in the United States?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thriller movie

questions.question: Who does Ken accidentally kill instead of the witness in the 1988 comedy movie A Fish Called Wanda?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Three dogs

questions.question: The show Mad Money aired CNBC cable/satellite TV channel on Monday, March 14, 2005 with what host?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jim Cramer

questions.question: What was the value of the smallest valued coin ever issued by the US Treasury?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: one half of a cent

questions.question: Which of these schemes from the 2004 movie Oceans Twelve requires a trained cat to be carried out?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hell in a Handbasket

questions.question: The government of this country condemned the 1997 movie Seven Years in Tibet and the director and the starring actors were banned from ever visiting the country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: China

questions.question: Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain is allowed by law to go practically anywhere she wants to in Great Britain.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What popular female singer and actress played Elsa Morganthall Strauss-Almerson in the 1999 movie Tea with Mussolini?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cher

questions.question: The 2005 movie Pizza My Heart was loosely based on this play by William Shakespeare.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Romeo and Juliet

questions.question: What do the children do with their obese mothers dead body in the 1993 drama movie Whats Eating Gilbert Grape?

options.text: Bury it in the back yard
Burn it along with the house

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Burn it along with the house

questions.question: Who usually is in charge of a US Army infantry company?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A captain

questions.question: The term piggy bank derives from the word pygg, an orange type of clay that used to be made into jars in which people kept their money.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Who was the British ruler at the time of the American Revolution?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George III

questions.question: What Academy Award did the 1962 movie Days of Wine and Roses, directed by Blake Edwards, win in 1963?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Best Original Song

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Country and Film
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, greers, bigfoot. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Retsina, sometimes referred to as the wine of the Gods, is produced in which country?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Greece

questions.question: Does Luxembourg, a small landlocked country situated in the north-west of continental Europe, have three official languages: French, German and Luxembourgish?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: Hairy man-apes seem to be everywhere. Which of these names is not used for them?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hairyman

questions.question: This French soccer player, who in 2001 was transferred from Italian team, Juventus to Spanish club, Real Madrid, won the 2003 FIFA World Player of the Year Award.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Zinedine Zidane

questions.question: What American female singer and actress makes a brief appearance in the 1999 comedy American Pie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Christina Milian

questions.question: This film style, generally used by film-makers with low budgets, originated in Denmark.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dogma

questions.question: The film The Legend of Boggy Creek was the tale of this creature.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Fouke Monster

questions.question: American artist and filmmaker Andy Warhol, a major figure in the Pop Art movement, is of Slovakian origin.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The Bigfoot of Florida is known by this name.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Skunk Ape

questions.question: This bloody battle, a turning point in World War II, was won by the Soviets in 1943.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Battle of Stalingrad

questions.question: The Polish food specialties, oscypek and bryndza are what  type of food?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cheeses

questions.question: What legendary actress played Holly Golightly in the 1961 movie Breakfast at Tiffanys?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Audrey Hepburn

questions.question: This modern-day European country, once ruled by Khan Asparuh, was acknowledged by the Byzantine Empire in 681.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Republic of Bulgaria

questions.question: What is the funny name of Judy Greers character in the 1999 comedy-drama movie Jawbreaker?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fern Mayo

questions.question: What is the special prize that will be given to one of the golden ticket holders in the 2005 movie Charlie and the Chocolate Factory?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They will inherit the factory.

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Ice and Bigfoot
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, bigfoot, bigfoot/sasquatch. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which company filed for bankruptcy in May 2009 and was partially bought by the US Government to keep production?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: General Motors

questions.question: What comic book is The Human Torch from?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fantastic Four

questions.question: Which of the following powers does Hancock, from the self-titled movie, not have?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: X-Ray vision

questions.question: The study of unknown animals is known as Cryptozoology.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which United States President related a story about a murderous Bigfoot in a Wilderness Magazine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Teddy Roosevelt

questions.question: What is the name of the Pixar-created family of superheroes?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Incredibles

questions.question: What is the head of the United Nations called?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Secretary General

questions.question: A plaster cast of a reclining Bigfoot was taken in September of 2000. What is the cast called?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Skookum Cast

questions.question: In 2008s Iron Man, Iron Mans suit is made of iron.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In 1958, this man discovered huge footprints left by a mysterious creature around a construction site.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jerry Crew

questions.question: What superhero does Hugh Jackman play in the X-Men series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Wolverine

questions.question: In December, 1968, the corpse of an alleged Bigfoot, encased in a block of ice was examined by cryptozoologists. What was the name given to the specimen in the ice?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Minnesota Iceman

questions.question: In Bigfoot Lore, who was Albert Ostman?

options.text: The first scientist to declare Bigfoot a hoax
A man who claimed to be kidnapped by a Bigfoot
Owner of the Bigfoot restaurant in Portland, Oregon
The first man to see Bigfoot

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A man who claimed to be kidnapped by a Bigfoot

questions.question: Which of these men has not written a book about Bigfoot/Sasquatch?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lawrence Hayden

questions.question: What was the name of Spider Mans main nemesis in Spider Man 2?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Doc Oc

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Fear and Term
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, john, condition. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which company developed the computer game Command  Conquer: Generals?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Electronic Arts

questions.question: What sport are the Washington Generals associated with?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Basketball

questions.question: Ephebiphobia is the fear of youth.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What is chemophobia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: fear of chemicals

questions.question: Who is the protagonist of John Boormans 1998 movie The General?

options.text: Pablo Escobar, a Columbian drug lord
Idi Amin, a dictator of Uganda
Martin Cahill, a criminal from Dublin, Ireland

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Martin Cahill, a criminal from Dublin, Ireland

questions.question: What is the translation of the term États généraux which was used to refer to the French Parliament?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: States General

questions.question: What medical term refers to the fear of horses?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Equinophobia

questions.question: What word means fear of animals?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Zoophobia

questions.question: What condition is characterized by fear of strangers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Xenophobia

questions.question: General Electric, one of the worlds biggest corporations, is active in many market segments. In which of these areas do they NOT operate?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: oil drilling

questions.question: What medical term means fear of women?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gynophobia

questions.question: What navy rank corresponds to the rank of land army General in the US military?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Admiral

questions.question: What is the correct plural form of Attorney General?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Attorneys General

questions.question: Which term means fear of spiders?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Arachnophobia

questions.question: Which of these leaders was NOT known as Generalissimo?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Adolf Hitler
